TEXT.TITLE: AUSTRALIAN CURRENCY TRADING SET RECORD IN JANUARY
TEXT.BODY: Spot volume in the Australian foreign exchange market jumped to a record 22.63 billion dlrs a day in January from 16.18 billion in December and 8.27 billion a year earlier, the Reserve Bank said in its monthly bulletin. The previous record was 17.51 billion dlrs last August. The peak broke a steady trading trend of 15 to 17 billion dlrs a day seen in the second half of 1986. Including forward deals, total deliverable volume was 27.01 billion dlrs a day (13.43 billion against the Australian dollar) against 19.56 billion (8.48 billion) in December and 9.92 billion (5.88 billion) a year earlier, the bank said. REUTER
